The One from the Himālayas
“Today is the fifteenth, the Uposatha day,
(said the spirit Sātāgira)
The divine night has dawned;
The Teacher named Anoman,
Let’s go and see Gotama”.
“I hope the mind is well directed,
(said the spirit Hemavata)
For all living beings, for the one who is patient;
I hope the desirable and undesirable,
Are under the control of thought”.
“His mind is well directed,
(said the spirit Sātāgira)
For all living beings, for the one who is patient;
And the desirable and undesirable,
Are under the control of thought”.

Nor do I say he is a fool,
But he speaks with meaning and with mantras.”
“Is he not attached to sensual pleasures,
(said the spirit Hemavata)
Is his mind not clouded;
Has he gone beyond delusion,
Is he one who has vision regarding the Dhamma?”
“He is not attached to sensual pleasures,
(said the spirit Sātāgira)
Nor is his mind clouded;
He has gone beyond all delusion,
The Buddha has vision regarding the Dhamma.”
“Is he endowed with knowledge,
(said the spirit Hemavata)
Is he one of pure conduct;
Have his taints been destroyed,
Is there no more renewed existence for him?”
“He is endowed with knowledge,
(said the spirit Sātāgira)
And he is one of pure conduct;
All his taints have been destroyed,
There is no more renewed existence for him.”
“The mind of the sage is complete,
Through his deeds and his path;
Endowed with knowledge and conduct,
I praise him for his qualities.”
